Detailed Description

Maps a message index to a message string from the return values from the exported functions in SESWrapper.

Definition at line 11 of file werror.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum WError::ErrorCodes

This enumerator contains the return codes from the exported functions. Errors are represented by negative numbers, whereas positive values indicate warnings. Success is always indicated by 0 (NULL).

See also:
gErrors
Enumerator:
ERR_OK 

Normal return code indicating success

ERR_UNKNOWN 

Unknown error

ERR_FAIL 

Operation failed

ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED 

Library has not been properly initialized

ERR_NOT_APPLICABLE 

Property or data parameter access not applicable (e.g. attempted to write to a read-only property)

ERR_PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND 

Parameter string was not found

ERR_INDEX 

Index out-of-range

ERR_INCORRECT_ELEMENT_SET 

The selected element set could not be set

ERR_INCORRECT_LENS_MODE 

The selected lens mode is not available

ERR_INCORRECT_PASS_ENERGY 

The selected pass energy is not available

ERR_INCORRECT_ANALYZER_REGION 

Error in analyzer region settings

ERR_INCORRECT_DETECTOR_REGION 

Error in detector region settings

ERR_READONLY 

Attempted to access a read-only variable or data parameter

ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT 

No instrument is loaded (see WRP_LoadInstrument)

ERR_ACQUIRING 

Acquisition in progress

ERR_INITIALIZE_FAIL 

Error in call to function GDS_Initialize()

ERR_LOAD_LIBRARY 

Could not load the instrument library

ERR_OPEN_INSTRUMENT 

Could not open the instrument configuration file

ERR_QT_RUNNING 

QT is running

ERR_INVALID_DIR 

Invalid SES directory

ERR_WRONG_SIZE 

Wrong parameter size

ERR_TIMEOUT 

Operation timed out

ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED 

Function has not been implemented

Definition at line 23 of file werror.h.

Member Function Documentation

WError * WError::instance ( ) [static]

Returns the address of the WError instance. If this is the first call to this function, a new instance is created. The reference counter is always incremented, and all calls to this function must end with a corresponding call to the release() function for a proper deallocation of the singleton when closing the library.

See also:
release()

Definition at line 77 of file werror.cpp.

Referenced by WSESWrapperBase::WSESWrapperBase().

std::string WError::message ( int  errorCode)

Extracts the error message based on errorCode.

Parameters:
[in]errorCodeAn error code previously returned from a function. If no error with this code is found, the resulting string is "Unknown error".
Returns:
A string describing the error.

Definition at line 61 of file werror.cpp.

Referenced by WSESWrapperBase::getLibError().

void WError::release ( )

Releases the reference to the WError singleton. This function must be called in combination with the instance() function for proper decrement of the reference counter and deallocation when closing the SESWrapper library.

See also:
instance()
